definition: connected with countries or groups that join together to fight a war or work for a shared aim
connected with the countries that fought together against Germany in the First and Second World Wars
(of two or more things) similar or existing together; connected with something
a group into which animals, plants, etc. are divided, smaller than a kingdom and larger than a class
to give time, money, tasks, etc. to somebody/something as a share of what is available
attractive and exciting in a mysterious way
a person who plays the lute
to name things on a list one by one
something that is said or written that refers to or mentions another person or subject in an indirect way (= alludes to it)
containing allusions (= indirect references)
a book or digital resource that is released every year giving information for that year about a particular subject or activity
a book or digital resource that gives information about the sun, moon, times of the tides (= the rise and fall of the sea level), etc. for each day of the year
a very strong interest in somebody/something that is unusual or not reasonable
the process of a gas becoming solid
the fact of being done, chosen, etc. without somebody deciding in advance what is going to happen, or without any regular pattern
a scientist who studies the spread and control of diseases
a scientist who studies pharmacology
the scientific study of the eye and its diseases
high in the air
not friendly or interested in other people
to not become involved in something; to show no interest in people
according to the correct order of the letters of the alphabet
being one of the letters of the alphabet, rather than a number or other symbol
that can be changed
a noisy argument or disagreement
an instrument for showing height above sea level, used especially in an aircraft
connected with films
connected with films and how they are made
a very long wooden musical instrument that you blow into, used for signalling in the Alps
